Package org.neo4j.internal.batchimport

Class RelationshipGroupCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.RelationshipGroupCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Iterable<RelationshipGroupRecord>, MemoryStatsVisitor.Visitable
    public class RelationshipGroupCache
extends Object
implements Iterable<RelationshipGroupRecord>, AutoCloseable, MemoryStatsVisitor.Visitable
    Holds information vital for making RelationshipGroupDefragmenter work the way it does. The defragmenter goes potentially multiple rounds through the relationship group store and each round selects groups from a range of node ids. This cache can cache the groups for the nodes in this range. First all group counts per node are updated (incrementGroupCount(long)). Then prepare(long) is called from lowest node id (0) and given the maximum configured memory given to this cache in its constructor the highest node id to cache is returned. Then groups are put(RelationshipGroupRecord) and cached in here to later be retrieved where they are now ordered by node and type. This will go on until the entire node range have been visited.
    See Also:
    RelationshipGroupDefragmenter

      • incrementGroupCount

        public void incrementGroupCount​(long nodeId)
        Before caching any relationship groups all group counts for all nodes are incremented by calling this method once for every encountered group (its node id).
        Parameters:
        nodeId - node to increment group count for.

      • groupCount

        int groupCount​(long nodeId)

      • getGroupCountCache

        ByteArray getGroupCountCache()
        Getter here because we can use this already allocated data structure for other things in and around places where this group cache is used.

      • prepare

        public long prepare​(long fromNodeId)
        Looks at max amount of configured memory (in constructor) and figures out for how many nodes their groups can be cached. Before the first call to this method all incrementGroupCount(long) calls must have been made. After a call to this there should be a sequence of put(RelationshipGroupRecord) calls to cache the groups. If this call returns a node id which is lower than the highest node id in the store then more rounds of caching should be performed after completing this round.
        Parameters:
        fromNodeId - inclusive
        Returns:
        toNodeId exclusive

      • rebase

        private long rebase​(long toNodeId)

      • put

        public boolean put​(RelationshipGroupRecord groupRecord)
        Caches a relationship group into this cache, it will be cached if the owner is within the prepared range, where true will be returned, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        groupRecord - RelationshipGroupRecord to cache.
        Returns:
        whether or not the group was cached, i.e. whether or not it was within the prepared range.

      • scanForFreeFrom

        private long scanForFreeFrom​(long startIndex,

                             long owningNodeId)
